step1.title: Assessment & Strategy
step1.desc: Complete evaluation of academic level and ambitions. Personalized progress plan with a clear vision of the end goal: the target school or university.

step2.title: Academic Excellence
step2.desc: Deep mastery of mathematics and physics. No cramming: I develop logic, analysis and problem-solving skills for lasting results.

step3.title: Ongoing Support

testimonials.label: Testimonials
testimonials.title: Hear from our students
testimonials.subtitle: Discover authentic feedback from our students and their parents

review_sarah.quote: Greg has been working with Max since 9th grade. It started just to bring up his math grades, then he quickly took over the bigger picture — course choices, specializations, the application. We honestly didn't think Louis-le-Grand was within reach. Max starts there in September.
review_sarah.name: Sarah K.

review_marie.quote: We started working with Greg in 10th grade, mostly math and physics. EPFL was the goal but honestly it felt like a long shot. He structured everything over two years — the courses, the application, all of it. When I got the answer I could barely believe it. Without him I wouldn't even have applied.
review_marie.name: Julien M.

review_thomas.quote: 780 on the SAT math section and a targeted admission strategy. Greg guided me from course selection to essay preparation. Admitted to UPenn early decision.
review_thomas.name: Thomas B.

about_preview.label: About
about_preview.title: Greg Mittelette
about_preview.quote_translation: We don't learn for school, but for life.
about_preview.text: Over 1,600 students mentored. 80% admitted to a top 30 global university or grande ecole. My edge: I know the final destination — Stanford, Polytechnique, EPFL — which lets me build the right path from day one.

q1.question: What commitment does this require from the family?
q1.answer: Serious mentoring is teamwork. I expect consistency in sessions, transparency on transcripts and goals, and real parent involvement in orientation decisions. In return, I commit to personalized follow-up and genuine availability between sessions.

q2.question: When should we start?
q2.answer: The earlier, the better. Ideally 6th-7th grade: we build the math foundations, choose the right curriculum, anticipate the key transitions. But I also work with students who come in during 11th or 12th grade — the work is different, more intensive, but the results are there.

q3.question: How many students do you take on?
q3.answer: Few. I follow each student personally, sometimes over several years. It's not a scalable model and that's by design. If I'm full, I'll tell you — I'd rather say no than do it halfway.

q4.question: What does the process look like?
q4.answer: We start with a diagnostic: current level, ambitions, target schools. From there I propose a work plan. Sessions are weekly, in person or via video. I check in regularly with parents and adjust based on results and deadlines.

q5.question: Do you work with families abroad?
q5.answer: Most of my clients are expats or between two countries. I work via video with families in Dubai, Singapore, London, New York. French system, AEFE schools, IB, BFI — I know these curricula and more importantly, how they translate in admissions files.

footer.desc: Elite strategic mentoring: STEM, SAT, global admissions. Ivy League, Polytechnique, Oxbridge, EPFL. Guidance for ambitious families.

thank_you.title: Thank you!

private.title: STEM & Elite Track
private.subtitle: The Continuum of Excellence: from STEM foundations to the gates of the Ivy League

audience1.title: STEM Foundations
audience1.desc: Starting from 6th grade, we lay the mathematical and scientific foundations that will make your child unbeatable by senior year. The expert who knows the end of the story – Stanford, MIT – is the only one who can write its first chapter.

audience2.title: Pre-Elite Track
audience2.desc: Strategic preparation for entry into elite tracks: Jeannine Manuel, EABJM, international sections, BFI. Methodical construction of the academic profile required by the most selective institutions.

audience3.title: Competitive Entry & Beyond
audience3.desc: Competitive exam preparation, mentoring through scientific preparatory classes, guidance toward top engineering schools and global universities. From prepa to the Ivy League.

private.lignee_title: We know how the story ends
private.lignee_text: The expert who knows the final destination – Stanford, MIT, the Ivy League – is the only one who can write the first chapter. Starting from 6th grade, we don't teach fractions: we architect a STEM mind to be unbeatable by senior year, and a profile to be irresistible at 18.
private.lignee_credo: If you're looking for someone to correct an exercise, you're not in the right place. If you're looking to secure a path to the elite, contact Carmine Admission.
private.continuum_subtitle: From Junior Excellence to Ivy League: we build the STEM foundations and the strategic profile required for the world's most competitive institutions.

format1.title: In-Person - Paris
format1.desc: In-person sessions in a dedicated space. Direct interaction for optimal mentoring.

format2.title: Online - International
format2.desc: Video conference sessions with interactive tools. Ideal for expat families and the AEFE network worldwide.

sat.title: SAT Preparation
sat.subtitle: The strategic weapon for America's top universities
sat.method_text: A structured 3-phase program: initial diagnostic, intensive section-by-section training, and timed simulations. Each session targets identified weak points to maximize the final score.

about.title: About Greg
about.subtitle: "Non scholae, sed vitae discimus" – Seneca
about.bio_text1: Paris-Saclay for math, Centrale Lyon for engineering, UPenn. I saw from the inside how admissions actually work. Who gets in, who doesn't, and why.
about.bio_text2: The most invested families are often the most misguided. They pay for tutoring, stack extracurriculars, hope the grades will speak for themselves. Meanwhile, the spots go to those who understood the rules of the game.
about.bio_text3: For 12 years, I've been bridging those two worlds. From 6th grade to the gates of Stanford, Polytechnique, EPFL. Not by teaching math. By building a strategy: which curriculum, which timeline, which positioning — so that on decision day, the application leaves no doubt.
about.bio_text4: 1,600 students. The reality hasn't changed: when you know where you're going, every decision becomes obvious.
about.philosophy_text1: I take on few students. That's a choice. Because my job is to know each one of them — their transcripts, their strengths, what they hide, what holds them back.
about.philosophy_text2: I follow them over the long run. Sometimes from 6th grade to the moment they open the letter. When I build an application for Stanford, Oxford or Ginette, I'm not taking a guess — I know what separates a yes from a no.
about.philosophy_text3: I live internationally, like most of my clients. We understand each other because we share the same reality: an ambition for our children, opaque systems, and the refusal to leave it to chance.
about.philosophy_text4: Today, I'm preparing my own children, aged 9 and 11, exactly the way I prepare my students. Same rigor, same vision. That's the most honest proof of what I believe in.

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.subtitle: Discover feedback from our students and their parents

integration.title: International Curricula & School Integration
integration.subtitle: Gain admission to the best schools. Navigate curricula to secure the optimal path.
integration.intro_title: The expert who knows the destination chooses the right curriculum
integration.intro_text: IB, OIB, BFI, international sections, traditional French system... Curriculum choice has direct consequences on post-secondary admissions. Every year, families make track decisions that unknowingly close doors. My role: identify the optimal curriculum based on the end goal — whether it's Stanford, Polytechnique or EPFL.

s1.title: Returning from Abroad
s1.desc: Integration into France's top middle and high schools: Jeannine Manuel, EABJM, international sections, elite lycees. We identify the ideal school, prepare the admissions file and ensure a seamless academic transition.

s2.title: Curriculum Transitions
s2.desc: Moving from the French system to IB or BFI, OIB to BFI transition, equivalencies and bridging. Every transition is anticipated and prepared so the student maintains — or strengthens — their academic edge.

s3.title: Strategic Track Selection
s3.desc: Which curriculum maximizes your chances for the Ivy League? For Polytechnique? For EPFL? The choice between IB, BFI, international section or traditional French track is never neutral. I help you make the most strategic decision.

integration.schools_subtitle: Successful integration and transitions into elite tracks
integration.cta_title: Need guidance on the right curriculum?
integration.cta_text: Every situation is unique. Describe your child's journey and target goal — I'll suggest the most suitable curriculum strategy.

admissions.label: Admissions Consulting
admissions.title: From academic excellence to the gates of the world's elite institutions
admissions.subtitle: Multi-zone strategy: Ivy League, Oxbridge, Polytechnique, EPFL, elite prepas
admissions.intro_text: Getting into Stanford, Oxford or Polytechnique demands far more than perfect grades. I transform your potential into a singular, memorable application through a proven narrative and scientific strategy, adapted to each admission system.

item1.title: Profile Audit
item1.desc: Complete evaluation of academic background: transcripts, class rank, strengths and areas for improvement.

item2.title: Curriculum Building
item2.desc: Strategic advice on advanced course selection (AP, IB, Honors) to maximize perceived academic rigor.

item3.title: "Spike" Development
item3.desc: Identifying a unique academic niche or passion to stand out among thousands of "perfect" candidates.

item1.title: Expert Math / Physics Mentoring
item1.desc: Intensive preparation to guarantee the top grades required for elite applications.

item2.title: Standardized Test Preparation
item2.desc: SAT / ACT strategies and coaching to reach the 75th percentile of target universities.

item1.title: Personal Statement
item1.desc: Brainstorming and crafting an authentic, powerful narrative that reveals your personality.

item2.title: Supplemental Essays
item2.desc: Fine-tuning your voice to meet the specific expectations of each institution (Stanford, Yale, Harvard, etc.).

item3.title: Activities Optimization
item3.desc: Strategic showcasing of your extracurricular involvement and proof of leadership.

item1.title: Intensive Mock Interviews
item1.desc: Practice with evaluation rubrics modeled on those used by admissions officers.

item2.title: Oral Storytelling
item2.desc: Turn every answer into an opportunity to demonstrate your "intellectual vitality".

item1.title: University List Selection
item1.desc: Strategic balancing of "Reach", "Match" and "Safety schools" to maximize your chances.

item2.title: Letters of Recommendation
item2.desc: Coaching to identify and guide teachers who can write outstanding support letters.

item3.title: 100% Digital Support
item3.desc: Maximum responsiveness through video format, adapted to international students and demanding schedules.
